p: In this study, 200 males (20 flies per cage) of wild type and RGE-treated flies were used for longevity screening. RGE extended D. melanogaster life span and generated significantly lower mortality in older population groups ( Fig. 2A). All wild type flies had died by Day 84, whereas the RGE-treated flies survived until Day 94 ( Fig. 2A). RGE-treated flies showed significantly higher mean and maximum longevities compared with wild type flies ( p < 0.01). In comparison to the wild type, RGE-treated flies had a 12.60% and 11.90% increase in mean and maximum life span, respectively.
